description.p: A Class_of_composition_of_activity is a mapping between classes of activity that indicates there are whole-part relationships between members of the two mapped classes.
The nature of a whole-part relationship between individual activities may be specified by indicating a class_of_composition_of_activity of which it is a member.

example.p: The relationship 'start up for daily operation' between:

ul.li: the class of activity 'Much Binding B two shift operation'; and
the class of activity 'Much Binding B daily start-up',

example.p: that indicates each two shift operation activity contains a daily start-up activity, is a class_of_composition_of_activity.
The cardinality for this relationship is follows:

ul.li: a two shift operation activity has one start-up activity;
a start-up activity is the start-up for zero or one two shift operation activities.

description.note: The cardinality for the relationship is within the scope of the Cardinality_of_relationship application module.
This entity is identical to class_of_composition_of_individual in ISO 15926-2, where the relationship is between classes of activity.

explicit.name: related_activity
explicit.description: the class_of_activity that has members in the role of part.

explicit.name: relating_activity
explicit.description: the class_of_activity that has members in the role of whole.
